newsitem.title: USA: Showers stall Missouri row crop harvest.
newsitem.headline: Showers stall Missouri row crop harvest.

text.p: Missouri farmers made limited row crop harvesting progress in the week ended Sunday as heavy showers interrupted fieldwork in many areas, the state's Agriculture Statistics Service said.
Soybeans were 83 percent harvested as of Sunday, 11 days behind last year's average of 94 percent and six days behind the five-year average of 88 percent.
The corn crop was 84 percent harvested, equal to last year's pace and behind the five-year average of 85 percent.
Sorghum was 85 percent harvested, slightly below the five-year average of 86 percent.

Winter wheat was 88 percent seeded, eight days behind last year's pace but one day ahead of the five-year average. The crop was rated two percent poor, 35 percent fair, 55 percent good and eight percent excellent.
Topsoil moisture was rated three percent short, 54 percent adequate and 43 percent surplus.
Pasture and range rated one percent very poor, 10 percent poor, 38 percent fair, 44 percent good and seven percent excellent.
